meanings.definition: In a devilish or mischievous manner
meanings.sent1: He grinned deucedly before pulling a prank on his friend.
meanings.sent2: The cat eyed the bird deucedly, plotting its next move.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel deucedly stole nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her deucedly clever plan surprised everyone at the party.
meanings.sent5: The deucedly playful puppy chased its tail in circles.

meanings.definition: Used as an intensifier to express annoyance or frustration
meanings.sent1: She was deucedly annoyed when her phone battery died during the call.
meanings.sent2: He was deucedly frustrated with the slow internet connection.
meanings.sent3: The deucedly long line at the grocery store tested her patience.
meanings.sent4: The deucedly loud music from the neighbor's party kept him awake all night.
meanings.sent5: The deucedly hot weather made it unbearable to stay outside for long.
